alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Pamlico; Southern Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Craven, central Carteret and southwestern Pamlico Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Minnesott Beach Ferry, or near Havelock, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Bern, Havelock, South River, Merrimon, Great Neck, Janeiro, Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal, Minnesott Beach Ferry, Neuse Forest, Arapahoe and Minnesott Beach. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
